title: Youth Leadership Program
description: Developing the next generation of community leaders through mentorship, workshops, and real-world projects.

blocks.title: Youth Leadership Program
blocks.subtitle: Developing tomorrow's leaders through mentorship, skill-building, and community engagement

blocks.imageAlt: Youth leadership students in a workshop
blocks.heading: About the Program
blocks.content:
Our Youth Leadership Program empowers high school students with the skills, confidence, and connections they need to become effective leaders in their communities.

Over the course of two semesters, participants engage in:

  • Weekly mentorship sessions with community leaders
  • Leadership skills workshops
  • Community service projects
  • College and career preparation

cards.title: Communication
cards.description: Public speaking, active listening, and effective written communication skills.

cards.title: Problem Solving
cards.description: Critical thinking and creative approaches to community challenges.

cards.title: Teamwork
cards.description: Collaboration, conflict resolution, and building diverse teams.

cards.title: Project Management
cards.description: Planning, executing, and evaluating community projects.

cards.title: Self-Awareness
cards.description: Understanding your strengths, values, and leadership style.

cards.title: Community Engagement
cards.description: Building connections and making a positive impact locally.

items.quote: The Youth Leadership Program gave me the confidence to apply to my dream college. My mentor helped me every step of the way, from essays to interviews.
items.author: Maria Santos
items.role: Program Graduate, 2024 | Now at State University

items.quote: I learned that leadership isn't about being in charge â€“ it's about serving others. That lesson changed how I approach everything.
items.author: Jamal Williams

items.quote: The community service project we led gave me a sense of purpose. I'm now studying nonprofit management in college.
items.author: Sophia Chen

blocks.heading: Program Details
blocks.content:
Duration: Two semesters (September - May)

Schedule: Tuesday and Thursday, 4:00 PM - 6:00 PM

Eligibility: High school students (grades 9-12) in our service area

Cost: Free (limited spots available)

Application Deadline: August 15th for fall cohort

blocks.heading: Ready to Lead?
blocks.text: Applications for the 2026-2027 cohort open in June. Join our mailing list to be notified.
